agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides employment training and support services for migrant and seasonal farm workers.
service_name: NATIONAL FARMWORKER JOBS PROGRAM - SOUTHWEST REGION
service_description: Provides employment and training services and educational funding for qualified migrant, seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers. A wide variety of support services are available to participants in the program.
site_details: Call for information and assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, Benton, Blackford, Boone, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Delaware, Fountain, Grant, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Henry, Howard, Huntington, Jay, Johnson, Madison, Marion, Miami, Montgomery, Parke, Putnam, Randolph, Shelby, Tippecanoe, Tipton, Vermillion, Wabash, Warren, Wayne, Wells, and White County -- Migrant and seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers -- Having a low income determination or disability -- Authorized to work in the United States, including all US territories

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - KNOX COUNTY - VINCENNES - FOURTH STREET
service_description: Assists individuals who are interested in starting a small business or expanding their current business. Loan amount is determined by eligibility criteria and available funding.
site_details: Visit the website to download an application -- Submit the application via mail, email, or fax. -- Call or email for questions.

site_schedule.name: Early Head Start
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Program: Varies; call for schedule

site_schedule.name: Head Start
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Program: Varies; call for schedule

site_eligibility: Persons who own or want to start a business in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County -- 51% owned by a US citizen -- Gross less than $1 million annually -- Other criteria may be based on type of loan
Living in Indiana -- With earned income (from full or part-time employment) -- Total household income at or below 200% of the federal poverty guidelines

Living or working in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County -- Families with children ages birth to 3 -- One of the following must apply: (i)At or below 100% federal poverty guidelines, (ii)Child is in foster, (iii)Receiving TANF or SSI, -OR- (iv)Child has a documented disability

Living or working in Daviess, Greene, Knox, or Sullivan County -- Age 3-5 (Age 3 by August 1st) -- One of the following must apply: (i)At or below 100% federal poverty guidelines, (ii)Child is in foster, (iii)Receiving TANF or SSI, -OR- (iv)Child has a documented disability

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE HEALTH CONNECTION CLINIC - KNOX COUNTY
service_description: Provides access to reproductive health services, including physical exams, birth control, pregnancy testing and verification, Pap tests, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and HIV testing. Services for both men and women. Offers medical exams, evidence collection, and support services for victims of sexual assault.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment -OR- walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit university offering many education opportunities including certifications, associate and baccalaureate degree programs, and cultural opportunities.
service_description: Offers a variety of general education classes, including one-year certificates, two-year associate degrees, two-year transfer programs and select baccalaureate degrees.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for an initial assessment. An in-home assessment and application will be scheduled.

site_schedule.name: Home Delivered Meals
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Meals: Mon-Fri (delivery time varies by location)

site_eligibility: Living in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County -- Ages 60 and older or with physical disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source
Living in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County -- Home-bound due to age (60 and older) or disability
Living in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County -- Seniors or persons with disabilities and their family, caregivers, and advocates
Living in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, or Pike County -- Seniors or persons with disabilities, their family, caregivers, and advocates

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from an Good Samaritan Health provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income (guidelines can be found on the website). Drive-through services available at this location for billing payments.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. -- Visit website to download, or call to request, a Financial Assistance Application.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Good Samaritan Health (or guarantor of someone who received such services)

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_name: INPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH AND ADDICTIONS TREATMENT
service_description: Operates an inpatient unit for adults in need of mental health and addictions treatment; 72-hour detoxification is available. Patients may be referred to long-term residential facilities throughout the state.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment.

site_schedule.name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- In need of inpatient mental health or addictions treatment (based on assessment)
Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children by appointment. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call intake line to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Outpatient Mental Health Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-8pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Thurs 8am-4pm -- Intake: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: General Counseling Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-8pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Thurs 8am-4pm -- Intake: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Adolescent/Youth Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-8pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Thurs 8am-4pm -- Intake: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Geriatric Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-8pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Thurs 8am-4pm -- Intake: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Psychiatric Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-8pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Thurs 8am-4pm -- Intake: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers individual and group counseling for adolescents and children by appointment. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the intake line to a schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 17 and younger; minimum age determined by individual assessment

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children by appointment and on a walk-in basis. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to a schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Outpatient Mental Health Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_schedule.name: General Counseling Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Adolescent/Youth Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Geriatric Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Psychiatric Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Substance Use Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Thurs 8am-6pm

site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers low-cost primary health care for those who are uninsured or underinsured.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Community Clinics
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-6pm; Fri 8am-3pm

site_eligibility: Low-income; uninsured or underinsured

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a walk-in clinic for minor injuries and common illnesses, immunizations, and physicals. Typically serves nonchronic conditions, including allergic reactions, asthma, wound care, infections, strains, sprains, and simple fractures. X-rays are available at this location. No sliding-scale fees.
site_details: Call before arrival. -- Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit counseling service for individuals with problems of violence or abusive behavior. Offers an Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence Certified Batterers Intervention Program.
service_description: Provides classes on recognizing and changing patterns of problematic or abusive behavior for men and women who use violence or other abusive behavior in relationships. Participants may self-refer, be court-ordered, or referred by the Department of Child Services (DCS). This 26-week program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV). Clients may begin the program at any time.
site_details: Call to schedule orientation. (Persons with a court-order must attend an orientation session to meet court requirements.)
site_eligibility: Men and women who use violence in relationships -- Age 18 or older or age 17 or younger with parent/guardian permission

agency_name: ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY TRAINING AND INFORMATION CENTER
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing community-based, nonresidential services for persons with disabilities.
site_name: ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY TRAINING AND INFORMATION CENTER
service_description: Offers information, training, support, and advocacy to help people of any age with disabilities achieve independence. Individualized on-site or in-home training may include: life skills, mobility/travel, managing personal-care assistants, using assistive technology, exercising legal rights.
taxonomy_name: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
Supported Living Services for Adults With Disabilities
nameLevel4: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
Supported Living Services for Adults With Disabilities
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
Supported Living Services for Adults With Disabilities
Health/Disability Related Support Groups
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri by appointment -- Groups: Times vary

site_schedule.name: Health/Disability Related Social Clubs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 7:30am-4pm; Fri by appointment -- Groups: Times vary

site_eligibility: Experiencing a disability of any kind (or acting on behalf of someone with a disability)
Middle school-aged through adults -- Diagnosed with a disability
Experiencing low mobility -- Not eligible for ramp or low-rise step assistance through any other programs -- With approval from property owner (if renting)
Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Knox County -- Age 6 months and older
Varies by service; call for details.
Varies by service; serves Knox County
Open
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Age 19 or older -- Living in Knox County

Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Varies by service

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach, including a food and clothing pantry, thrift store, and limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, hygiene items, and gently used clothing (baby through adult sizes) to those in need. Assistance is based on income. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Knox County -- Food Pantry: Limit one visit every 30 days -- Clothing Pantry: Limit one visit every six months

Living in Knox County -- Low income based on assessment -- Applied for assistance from the Township Trustee and Pace Community Action Agency (Pace) before requesting assistance from this agency - Limit one utility assistance per year -- Limit one rent assistance per year
Open

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit offering assistance in the Knox County community,
service_description: Offers case management services to families with children under 18 living in Knox County.
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: With children under age 18
Not used this pantry during previous 30 days
Open
Facing eviction or utility disconnection

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a food and clothing pantry to those in need.
service_description: Provides clothing to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Complete form upon arrival.
site_eligibility: Living in Knox County

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Knox County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large scale emergency in Knox County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Knox County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and other events.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. Pantry located in building behind the church.
site_eligibility: Living in North Knox School District or southern Sullivan County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing social service programs to people in need.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, frozen meat, children's and adult diapers to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living within North Knox School Corporation district -- Not used this pantry within the current month
Living within North Knox School Corporation district boundaries

Living in the North Knox School Corporation school district -- Age 18 or under have not received more than once a year -- Age 19 or older have not received more than once every two years -- Without health insurance that covers eye exam and glasses

Living within North Knox School Corporation district boundaries -- Not received financial assistance from this agency within the past 12 months -- For prescription and medical needs must be filled locally

agency_desc: A private fund providing limited financial assistance for utility bills to households within the North Knox School Corporation district.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance (up to $125) for primary expenses -- electric, gas, water, gasoline.  Restrictions apply, immediate assistance not available.
site_details: Call to fill out an application.
site_eligibility: Residents of North Knox School Corporation district -- Assistance based on assessment -- limit once per 6 months

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Bicknell or Vigo townships in Knox County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: BICKNELL-VIGO TOWNSHIP PUBLIC LIBRARY - SANDBORN BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Bicknell or Vigo townships in Knox County

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Bicknell in Knox County.

Acceptable items include oil-based patients, paint fillers, fluorescent bulbs, car batteries, electronics, flammable liquids, sharpes, and pesticides. The facility is only open on an as-needed basis; appointments are highly recommended.
site_details: Call to schedule a time to drop-off materials at this location. Staff will assist in opening the facility.

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: A not-for-profit electric distribution cooperative in southwestern Indiana.
